title: dg.differential geometry - Examples of why conditions for Novikov compact leaf theorem are necessary
body: Let $M^3$ be a smooth, closed 3-manifold. Given a smooth codimension-one foliation $\mathcal{F}$ of $M$ , the Novikov compact leaf theorem asserts that, when the universal cover $\widetilde{M}^3$ of $M^3$ is not contractible, the foliation $\mathcal{F}$ contains a compact leaf of genus $g \leq 1$ . What is the most basic example of a smooth codimension-one foliation with all noncompact leaves or leaves of higher genus on a smooth three manifold that has a contractible universal cover, such as the $3$ -torus? dg.differential-geometry smooth-manifolds 3-manifolds foliations Share Cite Improve this question Follow edited Jun 20, 2020 at 21:40 YCor 67.5k 5 5 gold badges 203 203 silver badges 301 301 bronze badges asked Jun 20, 2020 at 20:11 Daniel Santiago 105 5 5 bronze badges $\endgroup$ 3 3 $\begingroup$ What about $\Sigma_g\times S^1$? $\endgroup$ Michael Albanese –  Michael Albanese 2020-06-20 20:26:34 +00:00 Commented Jun 20, 2020 at 20:26 $\begingroup$ Thank you! That answers the question of higher genus, but I am still confused about examples with all noncompact leaves. $\endgroup$ Daniel Santiago –  Daniel Santiago 2020-06-20 20:46:45 +00:00 Commented Jun 20, 2020 at 20:46 3 $\begingroup$ Just take the codimension one foliation of $T^2$ by non-compact leaves (of irrational slope), and cross with $S^1$.
